posts.post_content: At last, a way to reanimate noncreatures and cheat them into play from the Graveyard! And it's even in [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites)' colors.
posts.html:
At last, a way to reanimate noncreatures and cheat them into play from the Graveyard! And it's even in Unburial Rites' colors.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Nucleon (4/23/2013 4:51:48 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker) is almost certainly the strongest thing in standard you can grab with this. Fun times.   
  
HIlariously though Five mana and two colors on a sorcery is actually a pretty FAIR price to pay for reanimation, when reanimation plans to get as good a mana break as possible.   
  
Powerful in how unique it is, but I think the biggest hurdle in standard is getting over how the majority of mill-searchers like [mulch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mulch) and [grizzly salvage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=grizzly salvage) are not hitting sorceries.
posts.html:
Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker is almost certainly the strongest thing in standard you can grab with this. Fun times.

HIlariously though Five mana and two colors on a sorcery is actually a pretty FAIR price to pay for reanimation, when reanimation plans to get as good a mana break as possible.

Powerful in how unique it is, but I think the biggest hurdle in standard is getting over how the majority of mill-searchers like mulch and grizzly salvage are not hitting sorceries.

Posted By: ChttrBox88 (4/23/2013 6:04:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Obzedat's Aid is a cool card for standard. Permanent is the key word here. For most decks lands probably not, artifacts most likely not, enchantments not really, creatures yes, and planeswalkers finally. Mana cost 5 is fair but 4 would have be excellent! Good overall but not for every deck. Certain decks can take advantage of it for sure. 3.5/5.
posts.html:

Posted By: Cyberium (4/23/2013 11:29:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker): "Hey... where the hell am I?"  
  
[Teysa](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teysa): "The Obzedat have revived you with purpose. Don't squander their blessing."  
  
NB: "Puny woman, do you think you can stop the mighty Nicol Bolas? I do as I please!"  
  
Teysa, to [Obzedat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Obzedat): "Shall we evict him? He's got attitude problems..."  
  
Obzedat: "YESSSSSS.... WITHOUT MERCYYYYYYYY..."  
  
  
\*does a [Merciless Eviction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Merciless Eviction)\*  
  
  
NB: "Huh... what? No! Wait! Stop! AAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!"  
  
  
Teysa, to Obzedat: "Okay, you said something about blue magic..."
posts.html:
Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker: "Hey... where the hell am I?"

Teysa: "The Obzedat have revived you with purpose. Don't squander their blessing."

NB: "Puny woman, do you think you can stop the mighty Nicol Bolas? I do as I please!"

Teysa, to Obzedat: "Shall we evict him? He's got attitude problems..."

Obzedat: "YESSSSSS.... WITHOUT MERCYYYYYYYY..."


*does a Merciless Eviction*


NB: "Huh... what? No! Wait! Stop! AAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!"


Teysa, to Obzedat: "Okay, you said something about blue magic..."

posts.post_content:
One of the more hilarious ways to win in standard:  
  
Loot faithlessly or salvage in a grisly fashion Omniscience into graveyard.  
Request the aid of several dead bankers in resurrecting the key to universal power and godhood.  
Enter the infinite and play the resulting one-of Borborygmos Enraged.  
Fling most of your hand into your opponent's face.
